result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean J. Campbell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (10 Days +), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sean J. Campbell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sean J. Campbell appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nathan J. Heim appeared by video for Sean J. Campbell.  Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
State moves to dismiss the repeater enhancer in count 1.  Motion granted.
NO CONTEST to the amended charge in count 1, fail to report to jail.  Convicted 
Defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for twenty (20) days to commence immediately.  Court imposes costs in the amount of $518.00 due in 60 days or 10 days jail for failure to pay.  DNA sample also ordered. 
Defendant has credit for 10 days.
Plea hearing on September 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea date on September 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea date on September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Order Denying Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail.
It is hereby ordered that the defendant's motion to modify bail is denied.

4:33 pm - Defendant Sean J. Campbell appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Nathan J. Heim appeared by video for Sean J. Campbell.  Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.  Inducement contained in email.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL - 
Attorney Heim argues for signature bond.  State objects.  Defendant has four open cases in multiple counties.  
Court finds cash bail appropriate and denied the motion.  State to draft order.
Plea date scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 09-07-22 at 4:00 p.m.    
Minutes.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody on bench warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail. The matters are continued for initial appearance on 8-29-22 at 1:30 pm in Branch 2.  Bail is set at $200 cash.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody. Court orders photos and prints at MTSO.
Bench warrant with service of officer thereon.
Minutes.

Prior: 177 Valley Rd, Sheboygan Falls, WI 53083
Re:  Felony failure to report to jail, repeater, on 07-15-22.
